intro: Rytidosperma merum, commonly known as the common spinifex, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and dense, wiry leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Rytidosperma merum plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for small desert fauna.
